vectorData.altText: 9. The tendons of muscles that adduct the wrist cross its ________________ aspect.
That's right!  Muscles with tendons crossing the medial aspect of the wrist act to adduct it.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

Muscles of the anterior compartment of the forearm flex the wrist. Muscles of the posterior compartment of the forearm extend the wrist.
What muscles abduct and adduct the wrist? Abduct your wrist. Where must the tendons be positioned to cause this action? Think, then click:      Adduct your wrist. Where must the tendons be positioned to cause this action? Think, then click:     
But, there are no medial and lateral compartments in the forearm! Whattup?!?

The answer lies in cooperation between muscles of the anterior and posterior compartments. Muscles in both compartments, the tendons of which cross the medial aspect of the wrist, work synergistically to adduct the wrist. Similarly, muscles in both compartments, the tendons of which cross the lateral aspect of the wrist, work synergistically to abduct the wrist.
As shown below, abduction occurs with pull across the lateral (green arrow), or radial, aspect of the wrist.
As shown below, adduction occurs with pull across the medial (purple arrow), or ulnar, aspect of the wrist.
